txt.en: 'How rude!'
'Well, the gall of some folk!'
'I got into quite a quarrel with Ted Sandyman when he told me the Gaffer's taters weren't as big as his own!'
'The Farmers Faire is my favourite festival of all! I like when the farmers judge the local pigs.'
'I made a daring trip to Farmer Maggot's field to taste a mushroom or two... but his dogs chased me away.'
'Ah, a beautiful day to celebrate the harvest. Blue skies and green grass as far as the eye can see, and the smell of fresh-picked vegetables!'
'That mayor never stops eating! A disgusting display... but that reminds me, I am rather hungry! Where is supper?'
'I burped. Pardon me!'
'I love festival times. Everyone lines up in the afternoons for beer from the special Inn League Keg!'
Nick Cotton
'Mmm. It smells so good, I can hardly wait!'
Waldy
'Hey, Waldy! Wake up!'
'There are some shrews in our fields. Hunt! Go on, hunt!'
'That was a passable meal, I suppose.'
Townsperson
'Hssss.'
'That mayor never stops eating!'
'I got into quite a quarrel with Ted Sandyman when he told me the Gaffer's taters weren't as big as his own!'
'I think Waldy is busy at the moment. Come back later; you'll see what he can do!'
'The Farmers Faire is my favourite festival of all! I like when the farmers judge the local pigs.'
'Dear me. It burns, it burns!!'
'I made a daring trip to Farmer Maggot's field to taste a mushroom or two... but his dogs chased me away.'
'Ah, a beautiful day to celebrate the harvest. Blue skies and green grass as far as the eye can see, and the smell of fresh-picked vegetables!'
'That mayor never stops eating! A disgusting display... but that reminds me, I am rather hungry! Where is supper?'
'I burped. Pardon me!'
'A toast to the fine farmers who made this Faire so delicious! May the hair on your toes grow thick and curly.'
'This Faire doesn't hold a candle to Old Mad Baggins's one hundred and eleventh birthday party!'
Rosie Cotton
Storyteller
'The Farmers Faire is my favourite festival of all! I like when the pigs judge the local farmers.'
'I made a daring trip to Farmer Maggot's field to taste a munchroom or two...but his dogs chased me away.'
'Ah, a beautiful day to celebrate the harvest. Blue skies and green grass as far as the eye can see, and the smell of fresh-licked vegebles!'
'That mayor never stops eating! A disgusting display... but that reminds me, I am rather hungry! Where is slupper?'
'I burped. Ha ha ha!'
'A toast to the fine farmers who made this Faire so delicious! May the toes in your hair grow thick and curly.'
'This Faire doesn't hold a candle to Old Bad Maggins's one hundred and eleventh birthday party!'
'I came all the day from Frogmorton to waste the vittles at the Farmers Faire!'
'What... what time is it?'
'So many... mushrooms. Oof....'
Jolly Cotton
Daisy Boffin
'A toast to the fine farmers who made this Faire so delicious! May the hair on your toes grow thick and curly.'
Farmer
'This Faire doesn't hold a candle to Old Mad Baggins's one hundred and eleventh birthday party!'
Tom Cotton
'I came all the way from Frogmorton to taste the vittles at the Farmers Faire!'
'Oh dear, have I already had too many? I do tend to get a bit rowdy when I've taken the drink....'
'Why yes, I suppose I did have rather a lot of ale. Was I making a fool of myself already?'
'Goodness me, I didn't know I was so drunk! I will have to behave better.'
'Oh dear, have I already had too many? I do tend to get a bit rowdy when I've taken the drink....'
'Why yes, I suppose I did have rather a lot of ale. Was I making a fool of myself already?'
'Goodness me, I didn't know I was so drunk! I will have to behave better.'
'I got into quite a squirrel with Ted Sandyman when he told me the Gaffer's taters weren't as big as his own!'
'Ouch!! Too much pepper!'
'Something tart will do nicely right now.'
'Did Opal forget to season this?'
'It just needs a dab of something....'
'Lovely, lovely.'
'Mmm! Whoever made this is worthy of great admiration.'
'Adding to this dish would spoil its taste.'
'I missed my shift?'
'Crisp flavour, hearty, and a clean aftertaste!'
'That was a nice set of flavours.'
'I fell asleep! It wasn't the drink at all! I'M INNOCENT!'
'First sweet, then salty, then savoury -- the flavours complement each other well!'
'Ack! Ss... spuh... spicy! Save me!'
'Nice and salty, but now my mouth is dry.'
'So... thirsty....'
'This was too fine a dish to be eaten without an accompaniment.'
'I must cleanse my palate.'
'Bland, bland, bland.'
'It's missing a little something...'
'Th-there's no need to pick on me!'
'This bread is too dry!'
'Boo hoo hoo!'
'Hmm. Not quite rich enough, if you ask me.'
'Why did you have to be so mean? I have a mushroom problem! It's a sickness....'
'All this eating is hard work -- exercise, if you ask me. I need to replenish.'
Horse to Sandson's Farm
Horse to Bamfurlong
'HEY! Who did that?'
'The ice delivery is here! Thank you for your patience, everyone. Frozen sweet-cream for all in just a few minutes!'
'The ice delivery is here! Thank you for your patience, everyone. The frozen sweet-cream will be ready in a few minutes!'
'I came all the way from Frogmorton to taste the vittles at the Farmers Faire!'
'Just who do you think you are?'
